titleStmt.title: L. A. Byron et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6364

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To the Honble Thomas E Bramlette
Govr of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioners would represent that in January 1865. that before County Judge a Justice of Peace of Clay county Lucinda Collins was fined the sum of ten dollars for an Assault committed on the person of Mrs Margret Reid a woman of notorious bad character in the Country; An Execution has issued on the Judgment, And payment will be coerced if not stopped by the Clemency of the Governor

Lucinda Collins is quite a poor woman with quite a large family of small children She stands fair in reputation and has the name of a quiet and peaceable neighbor, we therefore ask that the fine be remited this 26th April 1865

L. A. Byron
Thos Cook.
H L White
Ed Gibson

Refused
Richard T. Jacob
Lt & Act. Gov
